events.title: Execution of Queen Marie Antoinette
events.description: Marie Antoinette, the former Queen of France, was executed by guillotine during the French Revolution.
events.significance: Marked a significant moment in the radical phase of the French Revolution, symbolizing the fall of the monarchy.

events.title: Start of the Cuban Missile Crisis
events.description: U.S. President John F. Kennedy was presented with photographic evidence of Soviet missiles in Cuba, beginning the Cuban Missile Crisis.
events.significance: Initiated a 13-day confrontation between the United States and the Soviet Union, bringing the world close to nuclear war.

events.title: John Brown's Raid on Harpers Ferry
events.description: Abolitionist John Brown led a raid on the federal armory in Harpers Ferry, aiming to start an armed slave revolt.
events.significance: Escalated tensions that led to the American Civil War.

events.title: Opening of the Walt Disney Studio
events.description: Walt Disney and his brother Roy established the Disney Brothers Cartoon Studio, which would later become The Walt Disney Company.
events.significance: Marked the beginning of one of the most influential entertainment companies in history.
